description: Theodore Roosevelt was one of the most extraordinary Americans who lived, a larger-than-life legend whose story has to be seen to be believed. Ingeniously weaving extremely rare archive footage with meticulous recreations and the ...
keywords: president,president of the united states,progressivism,1900s,panama canal
name: The Indomitable Teddy Roosevelt

review.name: Good documentary! (I'm just curious about one thing...)
review.reviewBody:
I really enjoyed this documentary! I've been reading The River of Doubt and was looking for additional information about his extraordinary, complicated, and far from perfect life. This documentary delivered.

I AM curious though...did anyone else notice the giant baby head in the footage of the crowd after McKinley was shot? It was such a somber moment and then - what in the heck?! It cracked me up so bad. Why is it so big????
